thread.title: Busan International Film Festival celebrates 20 years
thread.title_full: Busan International Film Festival celebrates 20 years

title: Busan International Film Festival celebrates 20 years
text:
Busan International Film Festival celebrates 20 years 3:11am IST - 01:44 
International stars walk the red carpet at the South Korean film festival. Alicia Powell reports.   
Celebrities from around the world dazzle on the red carpet for the start of the 20th Busan International Film Festival in the South Korean port city. More than 5,000 filmmakers, entertainers and fans gather for the opening ceremony of the 10-day event, which was founded in 1996. Among those strutting along the red carpet were German actress Nastassja Kinski, Chinese actress Tang Wei and a fan favorite from 'Star Wars' -- R2D2 escorted by Stormtroopers. BIFF Executive Programmer Kim Ji-Seok says the festival is well prepared to become a major entertainment event. SOUNDBITE: Kim Ji-Seok, BIFF Executive Programmer, saying (Korean): "This year's Busan International Film Festival has invited 302 films from 75 countries. We prepared to celebrate the 20th anniversary of the festival with programs such as Asian Cinema 100. We will take this opportunity to become an Asian film hub, which is the goal of BIFF." Huge crowds lined-up to catch a glimpse of the activity. SOUNDBITE: Ma Xing Hui, film fan, saying (English): "I feel very exciting to come here, because this is my first time to see this grand place and see so many famous stars from all over the world. I think Busan International Film Festival is very, very good." SOUNDBITE: Ok Ga-bin, film fan, saying (Korean): "This is my first time here at Busan International Film Festival. I'm so happy that I saw so many movie stars in person. I hope that I can buy a ticket next year, to see inside the venue. I will come again next year." BIFF, one of Asia's largest film events, runs till October 10.  //reut.rs/1MLCHSi
